thread.title: Congress Should Not Act Like a Wax Museum

author: wsjcom
title: Congress Should Not Act Like a Wax Museum
text:
A class of politicians has emerged in our nation—one that makes Congress their permanent home and has no accountability or desire to achieve anything noteworthy for the people they serve back home. (“A Radical Idea: Congress Acts,” Review, May 19).
A recent example of Washington’s inaction happened right here in my own state. Sen. Bill Nelson and 11 other members of Florida’s congressional delegation sent a letter urging the state of Florida to do their jobs for them by passing state-level health-care policy because of their...
